desc_content.paragraph: Return if the app with the specified app_id is enabled for the specified course.

list_item.paragraph: app_id (str) – The app id for a course app

field_body.paragraph: True or False depending on if the course app is enabled or not.

desc_content.paragraph: Enable/disable a course app.

list_item.paragraph: course_key (CourseKey) – ID of course to operate on
app_id (str) – The app ID of the app to enabled/disable
enabled (bool) – The enable/disable status to apply
user (User) – The user performing the operation.

field_body.paragraph: The final enabled/disabled status of the app.

section.title: openedx.core.djangoapps.course_apps.apps module
section.paragraph: Pluggable app config for course apps.

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: AppConfig
Configuration class for Course Apps.
Override this method in subclasses to run code when Django starts.
Create a new CourseAppStatus object when a course app is accessed for the first time.
For existing courses CourseAppStatus object might not exist. This handler creates a new CourseAppStatus object in such cases.

list_item.paragraph: sender (str) – The sender is the app_id for the app being accessed for the first time.
course_key (CourseKey) – The key for the course run the app is associated with
is_enabled (bool) – The status of the course app

desc_content.paragraph: Whenever the course is published, update the status of course apps in the django models to match their status in the course.

section.title: openedx.core.djangoapps.course_apps.plugins module
section.paragraph: Course Apps plugin base class and plugin manager.

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: ABC
Abstract base class for all course app plugins.
Returns a dictionary of available operations for this app.
Not all apps will support being configured, and some may support other operations via the UI. This will list, the minimum whether the app can be enabled/disabled and whether it can be configured.

list_item.paragraph: course_key (CourseKey) – The course key for a course.
user (User) – The user for which the operation is to be tested.

field_body.paragraph: A dictionary that has keys like ‘enable’, ‘configure’ etc with values indicating whether those operations are allowed.

desc_content.paragraph: Returns a boolean indicating this course app’s availability for a given course.
If an app is not available, it will not show up in the UI at all for that course, and it will not be possible to enable/disable/configure it.

field_body.paragraph: course_key (CourseKey) – Course key for course whose availability is being checked.

desc_content.paragraph: Return if this course app is enabled for the provided course.

field_body.paragraph: course_key (CourseKey) – The course key for the course you want to check the status of.
The status of the course app for the specified course.

desc_content.paragraph: Update the status of this app for the provided course and return the new status.

list_item.paragraph: course_key (CourseKey) – The course key for the course for which the app should be enabled.
enabled (bool) – The new status of the app.
user (User) – The user performing this operation.

field_body.paragraph: The new status of the course app.

desc_content.paragraph: Bases: PluginManager
Plugin manager to get all course all plugins.
Yields all course apps that are available for the provided course.

field_body.paragraph: course_key (CourseKey) – The course key for which the list of apps is to be yielded.
